alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 5:40PM MST until August 24 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with brief heavy rainfall developing across portions of the Tucson Metro Area. The storms across the far east and northern portions of the city have produced up to a half inch of rain in 30 minutes. Rainfall amounts between 0.75 and 1.25 inches across the city will result in minor street flooding, and water running in normally dry washes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tucson, Oro Valley, Marana, Sahuarita, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Casas Adobes, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Tanque Verde, Vail, South Tucson, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, Tortolita, East Sahuarita, Tucson International Airport, Summit, Catalina Foothills, Sabino Canyon Recreation Area, Saguaro National Park East and Corona De Tucson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
